page.title: 01The Snowhill Area
page.content: The north side of the High Weald around the headwaters of the Mole and Eden Rivers comprises an area much of which used to be open common. It is now an area of woodland interspersed with small patches of farmland on sandstone in the south, and open pastureland with intermittent stretches of wood on the clays to the north. In the areas of the Cuttinglye, Furnace and Dome Woods, there are secluded estates of houses, while piecmeal enclosure of Copthorne Common in the 18th & 19th centuries has resulted in scattered housing along the A264 road forming the eastern part of Copthorne vilaafge and, east of the Duke's Head public house, the area known as Snowhill. The Furnace Lake and Hedgecourt Pond form the upper part of a chain of lakes along the Felbridge Water on
